oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Grand Army of the Republic medal
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Grand Army of the Republic (G.A.R.) medal. The Grand Army of the Republic was the largest organizaton of Union veterans. Established in 1866 in Illinois, at its peak it claimed 490,000 members nationwide and included sailors, soldiers, and marines.; The badge was worn at meetings and reunions and members are often seen wearing their membership badge in photographs.
